document_content.title: Referral to General Medicine for Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Fiona Bartlett is being referred to General Medicine for further evaluation of persistent fatigue and malaise of unclear etiology, ongoing for approximately 4 months.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: Ms. Bartlett reports increasing fatigue, low energy, and intermittent headaches over the past four months. She denies fever, weight loss, night sweats, or recent infections. Sleep is reported as non-restorative despite adequate duration. No recent travel or sick contacts. No history of depression or anxiety.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic illnesses. No previous surgeries. No allergies. No current medications.

sections.heading: Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker, drinks alcohol socially (1-2 drinks/week), works as a graphic designer. No illicit drug use.

sections.heading: Family History
sections.content: Mother with hypothyroidism, father with hypertension. No family history of autoimmune or hematologic conditions.

sections.heading: Physical Examination
sections.content: Vital signs stable. General exam unremarkable. No lymphadenopathy, pallor, or organomegaly. Neurological and cardiovascular exams within normal limits.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: CBC, TSH, and metabolic panel within normal limits. Iron studies pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistence of symptoms and non-specific findings, further assessment and possible additional investigations by General Medicine are requested. Thank you for your evaluation of this case.
